_description: Clinical trial terminology mapped to AACT database tables and columns. Used by the MCP server to expose the aact://glossary resource, helping LLMs translate clinical vocabulary into correct SQL.

domain_rules.explanation: AACT tables belong to either the Protocol domain (data submitted at registration, always populated for every study) or the Results domain (data submitted after study completion, only populated for studies that have posted results â€” roughly 13% of all studies). When querying RECRUITING, ACTIVE_NOT_RECRUITING, or NOT_YET_RECRUITING trials, ONLY Protocol-domain tables will have data. Results-domain tables will return 0 rows for these trials.

domain_rules.rule: Results-domain tables (only for completed trials with posted results)

terminology.context: When asking about PLANNED endpoints or outcome measures (what the trial intends to measure)

key_columns.measure: Free-text description of the endpoint/outcome measure
key_columns.time_frame: Time period over which the outcome is assessed
key_columns.description: Detailed description of the outcome measure

terminology.warning: Do NOT use the 'outcomes' table for this query. The 'outcomes' table is in the Results domain and is only populated for completed trials that have posted results. For recruiting or ongoing trials, 'outcomes' will return 0 rows. Always use 'design_outcomes' when the user asks about endpoints of active/recruiting trials.

terminology.context: When asking about ACTUAL results or measurements from completed trials

key_columns.outcomes.title: Title of the outcome measure as reported in results
key_columns.outcomes.param_type: Type of parameter (e.g., Mean, Median, Number, Least Squares Mean)

terminology.warning: These tables are ONLY populated for studies that have posted results. Filter studies.overall_status to completed/terminated studies, or check that results data exists.

terminology.context: When asking about statistical analyses of outcomes

key_columns.param_type: Type of estimate (e.g., Mean Difference, Odds Ratio, Hazard Ratio)
key_columns.param_value: Estimated value of the treatment effect
key_columns.method: Statistical method used (e.g., ANCOVA, Chi-squared, Log Rank)

terminology.context: When asking about where trials are conducted

key_columns.name: Name of the facility/hospital/center
key_columns.status: Recruiting status of this specific facility

terminology.note: For country-level queries, the 'countries' table is more efficient (one row per country per study) than aggregating from facilities.

terminology.context: When asking about safety or adverse event data

key_columns.organ_system: Body system affected (MedDRA System Organ Class)

terminology.warning: Only populated for studies that have posted results.

terminology.context: When asking about study arms or treatment groups

key_columns.group_type: Type of group (e.g., Experimental, Active Comparator, Placebo Comparator, Sham Comparator, No Intervention, Other)
key_columns.title: Name/title of the arm
key_columns.description: Description of what this arm receives

terminology.note: To see which interventions are assigned to which arms, join through design_group_interventions.

terminology.context: When asking about who can participate in a trial

key_columns.minimum_age: Minimum age as text (e.g., '18 Years', '6 Months')

terminology.context: When asking about who sponsors or funds a trial

key_columns.name: Name of the sponsor/collaborator organization
key_columns.agency_class: Type: NIH, FED (US Federal), INDUSTRY, NETWORK, OTHER

terminology.context: When asking about how a trial is designed

key_columns.intervention_model: Parallel Assignment, Crossover Assignment, Single Group Assignment, Sequential Assignment, Factorial Assignment
key_columns.masking: None (Open Label), Single, Double, Triple, Quadruple
key_columns.primary_purpose: Treatment, Prevention, Diagnostic, Supportive Care, Screening, Health Services Research, Basic Science, Device Feasibility, Other

terminology.context: When asking about publications related to a trial
When asking about how many participants enrolled, completed, or dropped out
terminology.warning: Only populated for studies that have posted results. For planned enrollment numbers, use studies.enrollment instead.

terminology.context: When asking about participant demographics or baseline measurements

key_columns.title: Name of the baseline measure (e.g., Age, Sex, Race)
key_columns.param_type: Mean, Median, Count of Participants, Number

terminology.warning: Only populated for studies that have posted results.

terminology.context: When asking about what disease or condition a trial studies

key_columns.name: Condition name as entered by sponsor

terminology.note: For standardized MeSH terms, use browse_conditions instead.

terminology.context: When asking about what treatments or interventions are used

key_columns.intervention_type: DRUG, DEVICE, BIOLOGICAL, PROCEDURE, RADIATION, DIETARY_SUPPLEMENT, BEHAVIORAL, GENETIC, COMBINATION_PRODUCT, DIAGNOSTIC_TEST, OTHER
key_columns.name: Name of the intervention

terminology.note: For alternative names/synonyms, join to intervention_other_names.
